datasheets.Rein_And_Raus.abilities.other: In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, if it is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move. If it does, until the end of the turn, this unit is not eligible to declare a charge.
While this unit contains 2 models, each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.
datasheets.Rein_And_Raus.loadout: ein is equipped with: sniper rifle; stub pistol; close R combat weapon. Raus is equipped with: demolition charge; stub pistol; close combat weapon.
datasheets.Rein_And_Raus.name: Rein And Raus
datasheets.Death_Rider_Commissar.abiliti: Once per battle round, at the start of any phase, you can select one friendly Astra Militarum Infantry or Astra Militarum Mounted unit that is Battle-shocked and within 12" of this model. If you do, one model in that unit is destroyed, and that unit is then no longer Battle-shocked.
While another Officer model is in the same unit as this model, you can re-roll Battle-shock tests taken for that unit.
This Officer can issue 1 Order to a Regiment unit. This Officer can only issue the Duty and Honour! and Fix Bayonets! Orders.
datasheets.Death_Rider_Commissar.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Death Rider Squadron You can attach this model to the above unit even if one Death Rider Squadron Commander model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.
datasheets.Death_Rider_Commissar.leads.e: You can attach this model to the above unit even if one Death Rider Squadron Commander model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.
datasheets.Death_Rider_Commissar.loadout: This model is equipped with: Commissar's pistol; Commissar's close combat weapon; savage claws.
datasheets.Quartermaster_Cadre_Squad.abi: While this unit contains a Quartermaster Revenant model, improve the Weapon Skill characteristic of this unit's Medical scalpels by 1.
Whilst this unit contains one or more Medicae Servitors, models in this unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.
uartermaster Cadre Squad | QUARTERMASTER: uartermaster Cadre Squad | QUARTERMASTER REVENANT: Character
datasheets.Quartermaster_Cadre_Squad.lea: This unit can be attached to the following units: ■ Death Korps of Krieg ■ Infantry Squad
datasheets.Quartermaster_Cadre_Squad.loa: T  he Quartermaster Revenant is equipped with: Quartermaster's pistol; Quartermaster's close combat weapon. Every Medicae Servitor is equipped with: medical scalpels.
datasheets.Mukaali_Riders.abilities.othe: You can ignore any or all modifiers to this unit’s Move characteristic and to Advance and Charge rolls made for it. In addition, this unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
datasheets.Mukaali_Riders.loadout: Every model is equipped with: laspistol; hunting lance; stomping feet.
datasheets.Mukaali_Riders.wargear.0: The Mukaali Rider Sergeant’s hunting lance can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 chainsword ◦ 1 power weapon
datasheets.Mukaali_Riders.wargear.1: The Mukaali Rider Sergeant’s laspistol can be replaced with 1 plasma pistol.
datasheets.Mukaali_Riders.wargear.2: Up to 2 Mukaali Riders can each have their hunting lance replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 flamer ◦ 1 grenade launcher ◦ 1 meltagun ◦ 1 plasma gun
datasheets.Sabre_Weapons_Battery.abiliti: Each time you target this unit with the Fire Overwatch Stratagem, hits are scored on unmodified Hit rolls of 5+ when resolving that Stratagem.
At the start of your Shooting phase, you can select one enemy unit within 24" and visible to the bearer. Until the end of the phase, that unit cannot have the Benefit of Cover.
datasheets.Sabre_Weapons_Battery.loadout: Every model is equipped with: twin heavy bolter; close combat weapon.
datasheets.Sabre_Weapons_Battery.wargear: Any number of models’ twin heavy bolters can each be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 defence searchlight ◦ 1 twin autocannon ◦ 1 twin heavy stubber ◦ 1 twin lascannon
datasheets.Heavy_Quad_Launcher_Team.abil: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, select one enemy unit (excluding Monster and Vehicle units) hit by one or more of those attacks. Unit the start of your next turn, that enemy unit is suppressed. While a unit is suppressed, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

Designer’s Note: Place three Crew tokens next to this model when it is first set up, removing one each time this model loses a wound (the Heavy Quad Launcher Team model itself is considered to represent its final wound).
datasheets.Heavy_Quad_Launcher_Team.load: This model is equipped with: heavy quad launcher; close combat weapons.
datasheets.Death_Korps_Grenadier_Squad.a: In your Shooting phase, you can select one unit from your army with this ability as the target of the Grenade Stratagem for 0CP, provided that unit has not already been the target of that Stratagem this phase. This can allow you to use the Grenade Stratagem for a second time this phase.
Each time you target the bearer’s unit with a Stratagem, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if there are one or more friendly Officer models within 6": on a 5+, you gain 1CP.
datasheets.Death_Korps_Grenadier_Squad.c: 1 Grenadier Sergeant, 7 Grenadiers and 1 Heavy Weapons Team
datasheets.Death_Korps_Grenadier_Squad.l: T  he Grenadier Sergeant is equipped with: sergeant's pistol; sergeant's close combat weapon. E  very Grenadier model is equipped with: hot-shot lasgun; close combat weapon. The Heavy Weapons Team is equipped with: heavy flamer; close combat weapon. GRENADIER SQUAD If a model from your army with the Leader ability can be attached to a Death Korps of Krieg unit, it can be attached to this unit instead.
datasheets.Death_Korps_Grenadier_Squad.w: Up to 2 Grenadier models can each have their hot-shot lasgun replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 flamer ◦ 1 grenade launcher ◦ 1 heavy stubber ◦ 1 meltagun ◦ 1 plasma gun ◦ 1 sniper rifle
datasheets.Heavy_Mortar_Team.abilities.o: While this model is being affected by an Order, provided it Remained Stationary this turn, ranged weapons equipped by this model have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability.
datasheets.Heavy_Mortar_Team.abilities.s: Designer’s Note: Place three Crew tokens next to this model when it is first set up, removing one each time this model loses a wound (the Heavy Mortar Team model itself is considered to represent its final wound).
datasheets.Heavy_Mortar_Team.loadout: This model is equipped with: heavy mortar; close combat weapons.
detachments.Combined_Arms.name: Combined Arms
detachments.Combined_Arms.enhancements.D: OFFICER model only. While the bearer’s unit is Battle-shocked, subtract 1 from the Objective Control characteristic of models in that unit, instead of changing it to 0.
detachments.Combined_Arms.enhancements.B: OFFICER model only. While the bearer is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a ranged attack, if that unit Remained Stationary this turn, a Critical Hit is scored on a successful unmodified Hit roll of 5+.
detachments.Combined_Arms.enhancements.D: OFFICER model only. In your Command phase, the bearer can issue one additional Order.
detachments.Combined_Arms.enhancements.P: OFFICER model only. Each time an enemy unit is set up within 9" of the bearer’s unit, the bearer can issue one Order. This is not counted towards the number of Orders the bearer can issue in a battle round.
detachments.Combined_Arms.rules.0.name: Born Soldiers
detachments.Combined_Arms.rules.0.rule.0:
Each time a model in a **REGIMENT** unit from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a visible unit (excluding **MONSTERS** and **VEHICLES**), that attack has the **[LETHAL HITS]** ability.

Each time a model in a **SQUADRON** unit from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a visible **MONSTER** or **VEHICLE** unit, that attack has the **[LETHAL HITS]** ability.
detachments.Combined_Arms.stratagems.Cra: One REGIMENT unit from your army and one SQUADRON unit from your army within 6" of and visible to that REGIMENT unit.
Until the end of the phase, Orders affecting one of your units affect the other, and vice versa.
The potency of armour and infantry is greatly enhanced when both work in close concert.
detachments.Combined_Arms.stratagems.Sco: One REGIMENT unit and one SQUADRON unit from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase.

Select one enemy unit. Until the end of the phase, each time your selected REGIMENT and SQUADRON units make an attack that targets that enemy unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
Armour and infantry work in concert, forming overlapping fields of fire against which neither cover nor heavy armour can protect.
detachments.Combined_Arms.stratagems.Bla: One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army.
Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

Until the end of the phase, each time a ranged attack is allocated to an INFANTRY model from your army, if that model is not fully visible to every model in the attacking unit because of your VEHICLE, that model has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.
The indefatigable tanks of the Astra Militarum serve as mobile cover for the troops marching in their shadow
detachments.Combined_Arms.stratagems.Fur: One ASTRA MILITARUM OFFICER unit from your army.
Your OFFICER can issue one Order as if it were your Command phase.
The greatest officers make their voices heard at the critical moment, their orders swift and decisive.
detachments.Combined_Arms.stratagems.Coo: One INFANTRY REGIMENT unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
Add a new unit to your army identical to your destroyed unit, in Strategic Reserves, at its Starting Strength and with all of its wounds remaining.
This Stratagem cannot be used to return destroyed CHARACTER units to Attached units. You can only use this Stratagem once per battle.
So numerous are the infantry of the Astra Militarum that fresh reserves can be called up at a moment’s notice.
detachments.Combined_Arms.stratagems.Fie: Any number of ASTRA MILITARUM OFFICER units from your army.
Until the end of the phase, your OFFICERS can issue Orders to REGIMENT units and SQUADRON units.
Some Astra Militarum officers have served with infantry and armour, and are equally adept at commanding either.
detachments.Hammer_of_the_Emperor.name: Hammer of the Emperor
detachments.Hammer_of_the_Emperor.enhanc: VEHICLE OFFICER model only. Once per turn, after the bearer issues an Order to a SQUADRON unit from your army, it can issue the same Order to another SQUADRON unit from your army.
VEHICLE OFFICER model only. The bearer has the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.
VEHICLE OFFICER model only. Add 3 to the bearer’s Objective Control characteristic.
VEHICLE OFFICER model only. Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes a ranged attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1.
Each time a **SQUADRON** unit from your army Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it; until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit, and when making that Advance move, that unit can move within Engagement Range of enemy models but cannot end that move within Engagement Range of enemy models.
detachments.Hammer_of_the_Emperor.strata: Blazing Advance
That SQUADRON unit.
Your Movement phase, just after a SQUADRON unit from your army Advances.
Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.
By petitioning the machine spirits of their vehicles, tank crews push their armoured steeds beyond conventional limits.
Furious Cannonade
One SQUADRON unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit within 12", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
At close range, armoured vehicles open up with their full complement of weapons, dispensing the Emperor’s righteous wrath.
Final Hour
One SQUADRON unit from your army that is Below Half-strength (excluding OFFICER units).

Until the end of the battle round, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit (excluding [ONE SHOT] weapons) have the [HAZARDOUS] ability, and each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, you can ignore any or all modifiers to that attack’s Ballistic Skill characteristic and to the Hit roll.
Even with flames licking through the interior of their vehicle, this crew refuse to abandon their positions, regardless of the risk to their lives.
Tactical Withdrawal
Your Movement phase, just after a SQUADRON unit from your army Falls Back.
Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.
Even in retreat, the armoured fist of the Astra Militarum keep their cannons firing.
Crash Through
One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army that has not been selected to move or charge this phase.
Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes a Normal, Advance or Charge move, it can move horizontally through terrain features as if they were not there.
Ruins, barricades, bunkers; few such structures can impede the grinding advance of an Astra Militarum armoured corps.
One ASTRA MILITARUM VEHICLE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack
Crews routinely reinforce their vehicle’s armour, adding ablative plating, track links, sandbags and other means to protect the hull.
detachments.Recon_Element.name: Recon Element
detachments.Recon_Element.enhancements.D: INFANTRY OFFICER model only. After both players have deployed their armies, if the bearer is on the battlefield, select up to three other ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY units from your army and redeploy them. When doing so, you can set those units up in Strategic Reserves if you wish, regardless of how many units are already in Strategic Reserves.
detachments.Recon_Element.enhancements.B: ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY model only. Once per battle, at the start of any phase, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, select one enemy unit within 8" of the bearer’s unit (excluding MONSTER and VEHICLE units); that unit must take a Battle-shock test.
detachments.Recon_Element.enhancements.D: ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY model only. The bearer has the Scouts 6" ability.
detachments.Recon_Element.enhancements.P: ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY model only. Each time an enemy INFANTRY or MOUNTED unit ends a Normal, Advance, Charge or Fall Back move within 9" of the bearer’s unit, roll one D6: on a 4+, until the start of your next turn, that enemy unit is stunned. While a unit is stunned, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
detachments.Recon_Element.rules.0.name: Masters of Camouflage
detachments.Recon_Element.rules.0.rule.0: **ASTRA MILITARUM WALKER** and **REGIMENT** models from your army have the Benefit of Cover. While such a model has the Benefit of Cover for any other reason (e.g. because it is wholly within a **RUIN**), improve the Save characteristic of that model by 1 (to a maximum of 3+).
detachments.Recon_Element.stratagems.Cra: One PLATOON unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [PRECISION] ability.
Reconnaissance units are often comprised of experienced survivalists and hunters, many of whom are expert marksmen.
detachments.Recon_Element.stratagems.Sco: One ASTRA MILITARUM MOUNTED or ASTRA MILITARUM WALKER unit from your army that is wholly within 10" of one or more battlefield edges and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
Sentinels and cavalry units use their speed and mobility to outflank the foe, ready to strike at the most opportune moment.
detachments.Recon_Element.stratagems.Bla: One PLATOON unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit, and is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".
Light infantry utilise harassing fire to draw their enemies into position for an ambush.
detachments.Recon_Element.stratagems.Fur: One ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY or ASTRA MILITARUM MOUNTED unit from your army.
Start of your opponent’s Shooting phase.
Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Feel No Pain 6+ ability, and each time an enemy model makes an attack, if your unit is the closest eligible target, subtract 1 from the hit roll.
These soldiers scream blood-curdling battle cries as they rush forwards, emboldening their squad mates and causing the enemy to waver.
detachments.Recon_Element.stratagems.Coo: One ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY unit from your army.
Start of your opponent’s Reinforcements step.
Until the end of the phase, enemy units that are set up on the battlefield as Reinforcements cannot be set up within 12" of your unit.
This unit is equipped with a scramble field generator, a device capable of disrupting teleportation beacons and other homing technology.
detachments.Recon_Element.stratagems.Fie: One ASTRA MILITARUM GRENADES unit from your army.
Start of your opponent’s Charge phase.

Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy unit selects your unit as the target of a charge, subtract 2 from the Charge roll (this is not cumulative with any other negative modifiers to that Charge roll).
Employed by skirmishers and recon troops, tanglefoot grenades ensnare advancing infantry, slowing their advance.
detachments.Mechanised_Assault.name: Mechanised Assault
detachments.Mechanised_Assault.enhanceme: INFANTRY OFFICER model only. If you control an objective marker at the end of your Command phase, and the bearer’s unit (or any TRANSPORT it is embarked within) is within range of that objective marker, that objective marker remains under you control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.

ASTRA MILITARUM TECH-PRIEST ENGINSEER model only. At the start of your Shooting phase, select one TRANSPORT from your army (excluding AIRCRAFT and TITANIC units) within 3" of the bearer. Until the end of the phase, each time that TRANSPORT makes an attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll.
INFANTRY OFFICER model only. The bearer’s unit has the Benefit of Cover and the Stealth ability while the bearer’s unit is wholly within 3" of one or more friendly TRANSPORT models.

INFANTRY OFFICER model only. The bearer’s unit can disembark from a TRANSPORT after it has Advanced. If it does, it counts as having made a Normal move that phase, and cannot declare a charge in the same turn, but can otherwise act normally in the remainder of the turn.
detachments.Mechanised_Assault.rules.0.r: Each time an **ASTRA MILITARUM** model from your army makes a ranged attack in a turn in which it disembarked from a **TRANSPORT,** add 1 to the Wound roll.
detachments.Mechanised_Assault.stratagem: Clear and Secure
One ASTRA MILITARUM unit from your army that disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn and has not been selected to shoot this phase.
Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit within range of an objective marker, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.
Mechanised charges rely upon shock, awe and speed to secure ground. Any enemies that block the path must be obliterated swiftly.
Swift Interception
One TRANSPORT unit from your army (excluding TITANIC units) that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, and is within 9" of the enemy unit that just ended that move.
Your opponent’s movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
Your TRANSPORT can make a Normal move of up to 6".
Fast-moving armoured transports allow a commander to react quickly to enemy movements and intercept outflanking opponents.
Hasty Extraction
One ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge.
Your opponent’s Charge phase, after an enemy unit has selected targets for its charge but before it makes a Charge move.&x20;

Provided your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and every model in your unit is within 3" of an ASTRA MILITARUM TRANSPORT from your army, it can embark within that TRANSPORT.
Should the tide turn against them, mechanised forces swiftly re-embark their transports in order to reposition.
Rapid Dispersal
One ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY unit from your army that disembarked from a TRANSPORT this phase.
Your Movement phase.
Your INFANTRY unit can make a Normal move of up to D6".
Troops trained in mechanised combat disembark swiftly from their transport’s hatches, avoiding incoming fire and advancing on their objectives.
Move Out
One ASTRA MILITARUM unit from your army.
High command’s priorities have shifted. Swift embarkation and redeployment is required.
Vox-relay
One INFANTRY OFFICER unit from your army embarked within a TRANSPORT. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it is embarked within a TRANSPORT.

Until the end of the phase, your unit can issue Orders even though it is not on the battlefield, and it can issue Orders to ASTRA MILITARUM TRANSPORT units from your army (excluding TITANIC units) regardless of the distance to and from your unit’s TRANSPORT.
This armoured transport has been modified to house a tactical command suite and vox-relay, enabling embarked officers to give orders from relative safety.
detachments.Bridgehead_Strike.name: Bridgehead Strike
detachments.Bridgehead_Strike.enhancemen: MILITARUM TEMPESTUS OFFICER model only. Each time the bearer issues an Order, if the bearer’s unit contains one or more models equipped with a master vox, it can issue that Order to up to three different REGIMENT units, instead of only one.

MILITARUM TEMPESTUS OFFICER model only. The bearer’s unit can be set up using the Deep Strike ability in the Reinforcements step of your first, second or third Movement phase, regardless of any mission rules.
MILITARUM TEMPESTUS OFFICER model only. Enemy units cannot use the Fire Overwatch Stratagem to shoot at the bearer’s unit.

INFANTRY OFFICER model only. After both players have deployed their armies, select up to three REGIMENT units from your army and redeploy them. When doing so, you can set those units up in Strategic Reserves, regardless of how many units are already in Strategic Reserves.
detachments.Bridgehead_Strike.rules.0.ru: Each time a **MILITARUM TEMPESTUS** model from your army makes a ranged attack in a turn in which it was set up on the battlefield from Reserves or it disembarked from a **TRANSPORT**, add 1 to the Hit roll.
detachments.Bridgehead_Strike.rules.1.ru: Each time an **ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY** model from your army makes a ranged attack, re‐roll a Hit roll of 1.
detachments.Bridgehead_Strike.stratagems: Bellicosa Drop
One ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY unit from your army that is in Reserves and has the Deep Strike ability.
The Reinforcements step of your Movement phase.

Until the end of the phase, when your unit is set up on the battlefield using the Deep Strike ability, it can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy units.
Until the end of the turn, your unit is not eligible to declare a charge.
Bellicosa drop protocols require intensive additional training but enable elite Imperial soldiery to land virtually on top of the enemy’s positions.
Firing Hot
One MILITARUM TEMPESTUS or KASRKIN unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.

Until the end of the phase, when targeting an enemy unit within 12", improve the Strength and Armour Penetration characteristics of hot‑shot lascarbines, hot‑shot lasguns, hot‑shot laspistols, hot‑shot marksman rifles, hot‑shot volley guns and sentry hot‑shot volley guns equipped by models in your unit by 1.
At the risk of permanently burning out power packs, hot‑shot weaponry can be temporarily overcharged to provide additional punch at the crucial moment.
Aerial Extraction

One ASTRA MILITARUM unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, if all of its models have the Deep Strike ability, or one VALKYRIE unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
End of your opponent’s Fight phase.

Such swift manoeuvres are vital to retaining command of the developing tactical situation, whether gunships are peeling off to strike at the enemy from a fresh angle or infantry being extracted by dropcraft for rapid redeployment.
On My Position
One REGIMENT INFANTRY unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
Roll one D6 for each enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit: on a 2+, that enemy unit suffers D6 mortal wounds. Then, your unit suffers 3D3 mortal wounds.

Circling Aeronautica Imperialis strike fighters wait above to launch strafing runs should the attack falter. In extremis, these assets can be called down upon Imperial positions in danger of being overrun, affording soldiers the desperate dignity of taking their enemies with them into death.
Servo-Designators
That ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY unit.
Your Shooting phase, just after an ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY unit from your army has shot.
Select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks that is visible to your unit. Until the end of the phase, that enemy unit cannot have the Benefit of Cover.
Released in a swarm from a modified Valkyrie gunship, high‑altitude servo‑skulls analyse targeting data from the ongoing fight and then provide updated firing solutions to the troops on the ground.
Fire And Relocate
One ASTRA MILITARUM unit (excluding TITANIC units) from your army.
Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced.
Once deployed, it is vital that the soldiers stay on the move and keep firing, avoiding becoming bogged down and maintaining the pressure on their reeling foes.
detachments.Siege_Regiment.name: Siege Regiment
INFANTRY OFFICER model only. While the bearer is leading a REGIMENT unit, that unit has the Scouts 6" ability.
INFANTRY OFFICER model only. Enemy units cannot use the Fire Overwatch Stratagem to shoot at the bearer’s unit.
INFANTRY OFFICER model only. Add 2 to the Attacks characteristics of the bearer’s Pistols.
OFFICER model only. While the bearer is leading a unit, when that unit is issued an Order, it is also affected by the Take Cover! Order.
detachments.Siege_Regiment.rules.0.name: Artillery Support
At the start of the battle round, select one of the following types of artillery support.

■ **Creeping Barrage:** Roll one D6 for each enemy unit that is more than 12" from every model from your army that is on the battlefield: On a 5+, until the end of the battle round, that unit is shaken. While a unit is shaken, subtract 2” from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for it. The maximum number of units that can be shaken by this rule in each battle round depends on the battle size, as shown below.

■ **Incendiary Bombardment:** Select a number of enemy units more than 12" from every model from your army that is on the battlefield. Until the end of the battle round, those enemy units are scattered. While a unit is scattered, it cannot have the Benefit of Cover. The maximum number of units you can select in this way depends on the battle size, as shown below.

■ **Smoke Shells:** Select a number of units from your army. Until the end of the battle round, those units have the Stealth ability. The maximum number of units you can select in this way depends on the battle size, as shown below.
detachments.Siege_Regiment.stratagems.Cr: One PLATOON unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

Until the end of the phase, enemy units are not considered to be within Engagement Range of your unit for the purposes of selecting targets of ranged weapons. Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy model loses a wound, while that model’s unit is within Engagement Range of your unit, roll one D6: on a 4+, one model from your unit is destroyed after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks.
All victory requires sacrifice. The destruction of the enemy must always take priority over the preservation of lives.
detachments.Siege_Regiment.stratagems.Sc: One ASTRA MILITARUM INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

Until the end of the phase, enemy units model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 2 to the result if it is a REGIMENT model. On a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.
Inured to the savage horrors of trench warfare, these warriors will fight until their last breath.
detachments.Siege_Regiment.stratagems.Bl: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit while targeting an enemy unit within half range.
Whilst accuracy has its benefits, sheer weight of fire is no less effective at bringing down the foe.
detachments.Siege_Regiment.stratagems.Fu: One INFANTRY OFFICER model from your army.
Until the end of the phase, when your model issues the Move! Move! Move! Order, it can issue that Order to any number of eligible friendly INFANTRY REGIMENT units, regardless of range to your model.
The whistle blows to signal the attack. Waves of infantry emerge from cover to advance upon the foe.
detachments.Siege_Regiment.stratagems.Co: One PLATOON unit from your army.

Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy unit ends a Charge move within Engagement Range of your unit, roll one D6 for each model in that enemy unit: for each 5+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).
Sappers have laid down a network of mines across the battlefield. Should the enemy attempt an ill-advised assault, they will surely suffer for it.
detachments.Siege_Regiment.stratagems.Fi: One ASTRA MILITARUM CHARACTER unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
Until the end of the phase, each time your unit makes an attack that targets a visible enemy unit within 12", you can re-roll the Hit roll.
As the infantry assault proceeds, flares are fired into the skies, illuminating opponents below.
name: Astra Militarum
rules.army.Voice_of_Command.rule.0.text:
If your Army Faction is **ASTRA MILITARUM, OFFICER** with this ability can issue Orders. Each **OFFICER** datasheet will specify how many Orders it can issue in a battle round and which units are eligible to receive those Orders. Each time an **OFFICER** model issues an Order, select one of the Orders below, then select one eligible friendly unit within 6" of that **OFFICER** model to issue it to.

**OFFICER** models can issue Orders in your Command phase and at the end of a phase in which they disembarked from a **TRANSPORT** or were set up on the battlefield.

Until the start of your next Command phase, the unit you selected is affected by that Order. Unless otherwise stated, a unit can only be affected by one Order at a time (any Order subsequently issued to that unit replaces the current one). Orders cannot be issued to Battle-shocked units, and if a unit being affected by an Order becomes Battle-shocked, that Order ceases to affect that unit.

Only **ASTRA MILITARUM**  models gain the benefit of an Order issued to their unit.
rules.army.Voice_of_Command.rule.2.text: Improve the Save characteristic of models in this unit by 1 (this cannot improve a model’s Save to better than 3+).
rules.army.Voice_of_Command.rule.4.text: Improve the Leadership and Objective Control characteristics of models in this unit by 1.
rules.army.Voice_of_Command.rule.6.text: Add 3" to the Move characteristic of models in this unit.
rules.army.Voice_of_Command.rule.8.text: Improve the Weapon Skill characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in this unit by 1.
rules.army.Voice_of_Command.rule.10.text: Improve the Ballistic Skill characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in this unit by 1.
rules.army.Voice_of_Command.rule.11.text: FIRST RANK, FIRE! SECOND RANK, FIRE!
rules.army.Voice_of_Command.rule.12.text: Improve the Attacks characteristic of Rapid Fire weapons equipped by models in this unit by 1.
